alert.note: Alert for Morehouse (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 02 at 9:01PM CST until January 02 at 11:45PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Morehouse Parish in northeastern Louisiana... * Until 1145 PM CST. * At 901 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bastrop, Galion, Mer Rouge, Collinston, Bonita and Oak Ridge. Additional heavy rain is possible later tonight into Tuesday morning, which could cause further flooding in the area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
